metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17081 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The gmc_mmx function in libavcodec/x86/mpegvideodsp.c in FFmpeg 2.3 and 3.4 does not properly validate widths and heights, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (integer signedness error and out-of-array read) via a crafted MPEG file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17081` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.1-1
libav-tools - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.1-1
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.1-1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '65.0.3325.181-0ubuntu1').
ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.1-1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
